```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)

```

Add a new code chunk, and read in the ces3demographics.csv data as an object called ces using a relative file path (with here) pointing to the file in the data folder within the project. Pipe directly into janitor::clean_names() to convert column headers to lower snake case (the default).
Save your .Rmd (do not knit)
Stage, commit, pull, then push to GitHub
In the GitHub repo, add your partner as a collaborator (you’ll want to ask them for their GitHub account or associated email to find them) by: Settings > Manage Access > Invite
Send them a message letting them know you’ve sent the invite

```{r}
ces <- read_csv(here("data", "ces3demographics.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names()
```
